title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 1. The Physiotherapists Registration Board Application for Registration
text_raw:
1. The Physiotherapists Registration Board Application for Registration 
Bye-Law 2016. (S.I. No. 496 of 2016) is hereby revoked with effect from the 
date specified in paragraph 2(2), without prejudice to any applications for 
registration received by the board prior to that date.
text_norm: 1 physiotherapist registration board application registration bye-law 2016 (s.i no 496 2016) hereby revoked effect date specified paragraph 2(2) without prejudice application registration received board prior date

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 2. (1) This bye-law may be cited as the Physiotherapists Registration Board
text_raw:
2. (1) This bye-law may be cited as the Physiotherapists Registration Board 

Application for Registration Bye-Law 2025. 

(2) This bye-law comes into force on the 7 January 2025.
text_norm: 2 (1) bye-law may cited physiotherapist registration board application registration bye-law 2025 (2) bye-law come force 7 january 2025

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: In this bye-law—
text_raw:
3. 

In this bye-law— 

“the Act” means the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (No. 27 of 
2005) as amended from time to time; 

“the Board” means the Physiotherapists Registration Board; 

“General Division” means the General Division of the register of the 
Physiotherapists Registration Board that was established and now continues 
under section 36 of the Act; 

“Referral for Radiological Diagnostic Procedures Division” means the Referral 
for Radiological Diagnostic Procedures Division of the register of the 
Physiotherapists Registration Board that was established and now continues 
under section 36 of the Act; 

“the Register” means the Register of the Physiotherapists Registration Board 

that was established and now continues under section 36 of the Act.
text_norm: 3 bye-law-- act mean health social care professional act 2005 (no 27 2005) amended time time board mean physiotherapist registration board general division mean general division register physiotherapist registration board established continues section 36 act referral radiological diagnostic procedure division mean referral radiological diagnostic procedure division register physiotherapist registration board established continues section 36 act register mean register physiotherapist registration board established continues section 36 act

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 4. The Board has determined that a person seeking registration in the
text_raw:
4. The Board has determined that a person seeking registration in the 
General Division and/or the Referral for Radiological Diagnostic Procedures 
Division of the Register shall apply to the Board by making an application in the 
form and containing the information set out in this Bye-law, or as otherwise 
determined by the Board from time to time.
text_norm: 4 board determined person seeking registration general division referral radiological diagnostic procedure division register shall apply board making application form containing information set bye-law otherwise determined board time time

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 5. Save where the applicant is already registered in the General Division of
text_raw:
5. Save where the applicant is already registered in the General Division of 
the Register, an application for registration in one or both divisions in the 
Register shall: 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 17th January, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [2] 3 

(1) Be made in writing or by electronic means on such form as is provided 

from time to time by or on behalf of the Board; 

(2) Contain the following information: 

(a) 

the division(s) of the register to which the application relates; 

(b) details and evidence of the applicant’s personal and contact 

information; 

(c) details and evidence of the applicant’s qualification(s) in reliance 

upon which the application is made; 

(d) details and evidence sufficient to satisfy the Board of the 

applicant’s: 

(i) 

(ii) 

(iii) 

(iv) 

(v) 

career and employment history; 

proof of practice in their profession (where applicable); 

membership of professional/regulatory bodies (where 
applicable); 

professional business operations (where applicable); and 

knowledge of the Irish or English language necessary for 
practising their profession in the State (where applicable); 

(e) details of health and character in a format satisfactory to the 
Board, for the purposes of assisting the Board’s consideration of 
the applicant as a fit and proper person to engage in the practice 
of the profession; and 

(f) 

any other information that the Board may deem necessary for the 
purpose of Section 37 of the Act; 

(3) Be completed, signed and dated by the applicant; 

(4) Be accompanied by: 

(a) 

the following proof and verification of identity: 

(i) 

(ii) 

(iii) 

a certified copy of the applicant’s valid passport or such 
suitable alternative proof of identity as the Board may from 
time to time determine; 

details of the applicant’s personal public service number 
(PPSN) unless no such number has been assigned to the 
applicant; and 

such other proof or verification of identity that the Board 
may deem necessary; 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

the application fee prescribed by Council under Section 18 of the 
Act; 

a completed statutory declaration; 

a fully completed and signed application for vetting disclosure 
(within the meaning of the National Vetting Bureau (Children and 
Vulnerable Persons) Acts 2012 to 2016 (No. 47 of 2012)) 

 
 4 [2] 

permitting An Garda Síochána to furnish any and all information 
lawfully permitted; and 

(e) 

in the case of applicants who have lived outside of the State for 
such periods of time as the Board may specify, a certified copy of 
police clearance from the jurisdictions of previous residence (or 
such jurisdictions as the Board may deem appropriate) and/or 
such other information as the Board may from time to time 
determine in respect of such periods; and 

(5) Be sent or delivered to the Registrar of the Board.

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 6. Where the applicant is already registered in the General Division of the
text_raw:
6. Where the applicant is already registered in the General Division of the 
Register, an application for registration in the Radiological Diagnostic 
Procedures Division of the Register shall: 

(1) Be made in writing or by electronic means on such form as is provided 

from time to time by or on behalf of the Board; 

(2) contain the following information: 

(a) 

details and evidence of the applicant’s personal and contact 
information; 

(b) details and evidence of the applicant’s qualification(s) in reliance 

upon which the application is made; 

(c) 

details and evidence of the applicant’s current registration in the 
General Division of the register; and 

(d) 

any other information that the Board may deem necessary. 

(3) Be completed, signed and dated by the applicant; and 

(4) Be accompanied by: 

(a) 

the application fee as prescribed by the Council under Section 18 
of the Act; and 

(b) be sent or delivered to the Registrar of the Board.
text_norm: 6 applicant already registered general division register application registration radiological diagnostic procedure division register shall (1) made writing electronic mean form provided time time behalf board (2) contain following information (a) detail evidence applicant personal contact information (b) detail evidence applicant qualification(s) reliance upon application made (c) detail evidence applicant current registration general division register (d) information board may deem necessary (3) completed signed dated applicant (4) accompanied (a) application fee prescribed council section 18 act (b) sent delivered registrar board

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: In order to verify the identity of an applicant, who has submitted an
text_raw:
7. 

In order to verify the identity of an applicant, who has submitted an 
application under paragraph (6), the Board may seek such proof of identity as 
the Board may deem necessary;
text_norm: 7 order verify identity applicant submitted application paragraph (6) board may seek proof identity board may deem necessary

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 8. An applicant shall comply with such requirements of the Board in respect
text_raw:
8. An applicant shall comply with such requirements of the Board in respect 
of education, training and continuing professional development as may apply 
from time to time.
text_norm: 8 applicant shall comply requirement board respect education training continuing professional development may apply time time

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 9. An applicant who wishes to resume the practice of the profession after
text_raw:
9. An applicant who wishes to resume the practice of the profession after 
not having practised the profession for such period as the Board may specify 
shall comply with such criteria or conditions as the Board may specify from time 
to time for the purposes of section 31(1)(fa) of the Act. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [2] 5 

GIVEN under the seal of the Physiotherapists Registration Board, 

7 January, 2025. 

RÓISÍN O HANLON, 

Chairperson, Physiotherapists Registration Board . 

JOHN BIGGINS, 

Member, Physiotherapists Registration Board. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [2]

title: it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This bye-law details the form and information to be contained in an application 
to the Physiotherapists Registration Board for registration the Register and/or 
division of the Register maintained by the Physiotherapists Registration Board. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [2] 7
